citation.article-title: Lactobacillus pantheris sp. nov., isolated from faeces of a jaguar.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus pantheris sp. nov.
Lactobacillus pantheris (pan'ther.is. L. gen. n. pantheris of the panther, referring to the isolation of the strains from jaguar faeces)
Cells are Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, nonmotile rods, 0.5x1.5-2.5 μm in size after 24 h incubation in TPYG liquid medium.
D(-)-Lactic acid but no gas is produced from glucose fermentation.
Colonies are convex, opaque and rough with irregular edges and less than 1 mm in diameter after 24 h cultivation on TPYG plates.
Growth occurred at 10 °C but not at 45 °C.
The optimum pH for growth is 6.0-6.4 and growth can occur at pH 4.5, but not at pH values above 7.5.
Ammonia is produced from arginine and aesculin is hydrolysed.
Acid is produced from galactose, D-glucose, D-fructose, D-mannose, N-acetyl glucosamine, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, trehalose, β-gentiobiose and D-tagatose.

Acid is not produced from glycerol, erythritol, D-arabinose, L-arabinose, ribose, D-xylose, L-xylose, adonitol, methyl β-xyloside, L-sorbose, rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, methyl α-D-mannoside, methyl α-D- raffinose, starch, glycogen, xylitol, D-turanose, D-lyxose, D-fucose, L-fucose, D-arabitol, gluconate, 2- ketogluconate or 5-ketogluconate.
The DNA G+C content of strain A24-2-1T is 52.7 mol%.
The type strain and a second strain, A24-1-5, were isolated from the faeces of a jaguar in Beijing Zoo.
The type strain is strain A24-2-1T (=AS 1.2826T=LMG 21017T).
